full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 107 of 236 LC3Cmax3 Parkinson - direct MS. COMEY: Government calls Gregory Parkinson. THE COURT: Gregory Parkinson may come forward. GREGORY PARKINSON, called as a witness by the Government, having been duly sworn, testified as follows: THE COURT: Mr. Parkinson, you may remove your mask and please state and spell your name for the record. THE WITNESS: My name is Gregory Parkinson, G-r-e-g-o-r-y P-a-r-k-i-n-s-o-n. THE COURT: Ms. Comey, you may proceed. MS. COMEY: Thank you, your Honor. DIRECT EXAMINATION BY MS. COMEY: Q. Good afternoon, Mr. Parkinson. A. Good afternoon, counselor. Q. What kind of work do you do right now? A. I am a retired police officer that devotes some of my time to mentoring new people coming into the world of crime scene investigation. THE COURT: Mr. Parkinson, can I ask you to shift the microphone a little bit closer and speak directly into it if you can. THE WITNESS: Yes, your Honor. Q. Mr. Parkinson, so would you briefly walk us through your law enforcement career before you were retired. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00018208
